intro: Ellisia torreyi var. paniculata, commonly known as the paniculate ellisia, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a branched inflorescence, known as a paniculate cluster. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is typically found in shaded, forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
